entry.title: Install Node-v6.9.4 and Hexo-v3.2.2 on Ubuntu 16.04
entry.content: This tutorial will show you how to install node and hexo on your ubuntu and deploy a blog on github. Install Node.js and npmDownload the latest package on the official websiteClick here to download node-v6.9.4-linux-x64.tar.xz or you can visit download page for other suitalbel version. Extract the package and installEnter the directory you download it. Extract package and move to /opt directory to install.12tar -xJf node-v6.9.4-linux-x64.tar.xzsudo mv node-v6.9.4-linux-x64 /opt Add softlinks for node and npm (package manager for JavaScript)12sudo ln -s /opt/node-v6.9.4-linux-x64/bin/node /usr/local/bin/nodesudo ln -s /opt/node-v6.9.4-linux-x64/bin/npm /usr/local/bin/npm Now you can run node -v and npm -v to check it. You can find v6.9.4 3.10.10 on your terminal if installed correctly Install HexoUse npm to install hexo and add a softlink.12npm install hexo-cli -gsudo ln -s /opt/node-v6.9.4-linux-x64/bin/hexo /usr/local/bin/hexo At this time, when you type in hexo -v, you can see hexo: 3.2.2 hexo-cli: 1.0.2 os: Linux 4.4.0-59-generic linux x64 http_parser: 2.7.0 node: 6.9.4 v8: 5.1.281.89 uv: 1.9.1 zlib: 1.2.8 ares: 1.10.1-DEV icu: 57.1 modules: 48 openssl: 1.0.2j Start Build your blog with hexoInit your blog1234~$ hexo init your_blog_name~$ cd your_blog_name~/your_blog_name$ npm install~/your_blog_name$ hexo server The codes above play these roles: init a folder to manage your blog, the whole content of your blog will be here enter blog directory install related components(I guess :D ) start local server After all these, type localhost:4000 in web browser’s address bar to visit the welcome page! Qucik start1234hexo new "your_article_title"hexo serverhexo generatehexo deploy create a new article in your blog, edit it in the directory /source/_posts(Markdown supported). start local server for a preview according to previous modifies, generate static files in local space. deploy your website However, if you try to deploy it right now, there will be several mistakes. Before deploymentTake github for example, open the file _config.yml in your blog directory, find the label # deploment and edit it like the following: # Deployment ## Docs: https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html deploy: type: git repo: your_repository_address branch: master and load git deployer package.1npm install hexo-deployer-git --save The last step, make sure git installed on your ubuntu,run git version to check.If not,qucikly install it by sudo apt install git If everything well-settled, now you can deploy your blog!12hexo generatehexo deploy During the deployment,your github username and password would be asked.Remember hexo generate before every deployment,or nothing will change. PS:Once after hexo deploy, fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories) happened, delete the file .deploy_git and try it again will help. Personalize your blogYou can change the theme of your blog freely. There will not be too much introduction here. By the way,”Next” is a populer theme of hexo. You can learn more about it English Doc/Chinese Doc.

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
